Servicing Agency Scope: cloud.gov is a secure, centralized, and open source Platform as a Service (PaaS) solution built specifically for federal government agencies.  cloud.gov offers sandbox, prototyping / development, and production environments that allow federal government agencies to host and update applications, websites, Application Program Interfaces (APIs), and other services.
Other Services: Enterprise Container Platform, Virtual Application Hosting
Authority for Interagency Agreements (IA: 40 USC 321 Acquisition Services Fund, 40 USC 501 Services for Executive Agencies

Servicing Agency Scope: Federalist is an IDEA Act and 508-compliant content publishing platform for US Government websites. The Federalist platform includes support for blogs, customizable web pages, a search interface, built-in site analytics, the ability to host and view data visualizations, and connect to cloud.gov's storage via an Application Program Interface (API). The Federalist platform uses a public code hosting service to load and store code for websites (e.g., GitHub). Federalist requires familiarity and technical competence with Cascading Style Sheets (CSS), Gatsby, GitHub, Hypertext Markup Language (HTML), Hugo, JavaScript, Jekyll, and Node.js software languages and toolsets.
Authority for Interagency Agreements (IA: 40 USC 321 Acquisition Services Fund, 40 USC 501 Services for Executive Agencies

Servicing Agency Office: Office of the Chief Information Officer - Digital Infrastructure Services Center (OCIO-DISC)
Servicing Agency Scope: The OCIO-DISC manages a Government Enterprise Data Center providing Cloud services to requesting agencies.
Other Services: Commercial Cloud Access Point (CAP), Disaster Recovery, Enterprise Container Platform, Mainframe, Social Networking Solutions, Virtual Application Hosting
